Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Jar stand
Description: Very elegant jar stand made from calcareous clay from Upper Egypt. This clay is pink-orange inside and white on the surface. The bottom section is flared and the upper section bordered with a convex lip. The curved mid-section bears three scratches made before firing -- a decoration as opposed to a potter's mark.
